str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To direct my gaze, look steadily. From a compound of a and teino; to gaze intently.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A council, tribunal; the Sanhedrin, the meeting place of the Sanhedrin.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To live the life of a citizen, live. Middle voice of a derivative of polites; to behave as a citizen.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.
As far as, up to, until, during. Or achris akh'-rece; akin to akron; until or up to.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
